items.title: Toyota to build Lexus EV plant in Shanghai
items.summary:
- Toyota has signed an agreement with the Shanghai government to establish a Lexus EV and battery facility in Jinshan District by 2027.
- This marks a shift for Lexus to move from reliance on imports as Toyota aims to enhance its presence in China, the largest new energy vehicle market.
- Toyota is expanding local R&D partnerships, including with Huawei for smart vehicle technologies, targeting at least 2.5 million annual vehicle production by 2030 with China-specific electrified models introduced in 2025.

items.title: Caught in the fintech-bank tug-of-war
items.summary:
- The article discusses the tension between traditional banks and fintech platforms in managing startup finances.
- Highlights include the speed and ease of fintech platforms versus the lengthy processes of traditional banks.
- Startups may benefit from a hybrid approach, using both banks and fintech solutions for financial management.

items.title: The Parentinc names new group CFO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The Parentinc has appointed Dinesh Uruthiramoorthy as its group CFO.
- His role focuses on supporting the company's expansion in Southeast Asia’s mum-and-baby market.
- Uruthiramoorthy brings significant experience from Multiplier, Carousell, and Singtel Group, with expertise in strategic finance.
- The Parentinc operates several brands, including Mama’s Choice and theAsianparent.
- As group CFO, he will work to enhance financial infrastructure to drive profitability and sustain growth.

items.title: Alibaba dismisses $1b DeepSeek investment rumors
Paris hosts AI summit with world leaders, tech giants
items.summary:
- Paris will host a summit on February 11 focused on AI regulation and innovation oversight.
- Attendees include US Vice President JD Vance, Chinese Vice Premier Zhang Guoqing, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis, and French President Emmanuel Macron.
- Tech leaders such as Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman will participate in discussions.
- The summit follows the EU’s approval of the AI Act, the first legal framework for AI, raising debates on its impact on innovation.

items.title: Swiggy stock hits 52-week low after Q3 loss surge
items.summary:
- Swiggy’s stock fell nearly 6% to 359 rupees (US$4.10) on Feb. 10, marking a 52-week low on BSE.
- The drop followed a 39.1% increase in Swiggy's consolidated net loss for Q3 FY25, reaching ₹799 crore.
- Market cap stands at 82.795 crore rupees (US$9.5 million) with over 1.5 crore shares traded.
- Bernstein lowered Swiggy’s target price from 635 rupees (US$7.25) to 575 rupees (US$6.57).

items.title: Indian fintech firm Rupeeflo raises $1m pre-seed funding
items.author: Dharmendra Maurya, Ashish Jha, Manav Bharambe
items.summary:
- Rupeeflo, a fintech platform for non-resident Indians (NRIs), has raised $1 million in pre-seed funding.
- Funding led by Piper Serica Angel Fund with participation from fintech professionals including Ravi Shankar, Kishore Natarajan, and Kedar Kulkarni.
- Founded in 2024, Rupeeflo aims to simplify financial service access for NRIs, with initial target markets being the US and UK.

items.title: Delivery Hero profitable for first time since 2023
items.summary:
- Delivery Hero achieved positive free cash flow for the first time in late 2023 following cost-cutting efforts.
- In December 2024, the company listed its Middle Eastern unit, Talabat, in Dubai, raising US$2 billion.
- Talabat generated US$5.3 billion in sales in the first three quarters of 2024.
- The proposed sale of Taiwan operations to Uber was blocked by regulators.
- Rivals like Couping and Grab are increasing competition in South Korea and Southeast Asia.
- Delivery Hero is exploring automation options with robots and drones for deliveries.
- Q4 results are expected this week, with 2024 adjusted earnings projected to be between €725 million and €775 million.

items.title: TSMC growth slows as DeepSeek fuels AI competition
items.summary:
- TSMC reported a 36% revenue increase in January, totaling NT$293.3 billion (US$8.9 billion).
- This is a slowdown from the 38.8% growth in Q4 2024.
- Industry analysts expected a 41% sales increase for Q1, but fluctuations in AI spending caused volatility.
- Chinese startup DeepSeek introduced lower-priced AI models, escalating competition.
- Major companies like Microsoft, Alphabet, and Meta continue investing heavily in AI, with Amazon planning US$100 billion in initiatives.
- TSMC set capital expenditures of US$42 billion for 2025, relying on demand forecasts.
- Geopolitical uncertainty, with potential U.S. tariffs on semiconductor imports, poses challenges.

items.title: Grab just can’t quit GoTo
items.summary:
- Grab has a continuing relationship with GoTo, a major player in the Southeast Asian tech space.
- Despite challenges, Grab has maintained its collaboration with GoTo for various business initiatives.
- The partnership is seen as crucial for both companies as they navigate the competitive market landscape.

items.title: Southeast Asia’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
Venturi Partners invests $25m in Indian footwear brand JQR
items.summary:
- Venturi Partners, a Singapore-based investment firm, invests US$25 million in Indian footwear brand JQR.
- This is JQR's first venture capital investment, acquiring an undisclosed minority stake.
- Founded in 2014, JQR targets India’s US$12 billion affordable footwear market with a focus on in-house design and vertically integrated manufacturing.
- The investment aims to support JQR's market expansion, enhance online sales, and diversify its product offerings.
- Venturi Partners invests in consumer-focused businesses in India and Southeast Asia, with a portfolio including brands like Livspace and Country Delight.

items.title: East Ventures, SV Investment launch tech startup fund
items.summary:
- East Ventures and SV Investment have announced the first close of their joint fund, the "East Ventures South Korea Fund in partnership with SV Investment."
- The fund aims to invest in tech startups in Southeast Asia and South Korea, specifically targeting revenue-generating series A to B startups.
- Investment commitments will range from US$1 million to US$3 million per startup, with a final close anticipated by mid-2025.
- The fund is anchored by South Korea’s state-owned Korea Development Bank (KDB) and supported by investors from Korea and Indonesia.

items.title: UpGrad co-founder’s BorderPlus raises $7m after launch
items.author: Mayank Kumar, Mithun Sacheti, Ritesh Agarwal, Apoorva Patni, Binny Bansal
items.summary:
- Mayank Kumar, co-founder of upGrad, raises US$7 million for BorderPlus in a first funding round.
- The funding was announced shortly after the startup's launch.
- Led by Owl Ventures, with participation from notable investors like Ritesh Agarwal and Binny Bansal.
- Funds will be used to enhance the platform and pursue new partnerships and expansion opportunities.

items.title: More loans, more growth? Indonesian banks think so
items.summary:
- Indonesia's banking industry is focusing on increasing lending as it enters 2025.
- Bank Indonesia (BI) cut its benchmark rate by 25 basis points to 5.75% and adjusted other rates to boost lending growth.
- BI aims for bank lending growth of 11% to 13% in 2025, having already provided 295 trillion rupiah in liquidity incentives.
- Liquidity will be directed towards growth sectors like agriculture, manufacturing, transportation, and tourism.
- Credit growth was effective in 2024 due to liquidity incentives, reaching over 10% compared to 9.6% without them.
- Indonesia's Financial Services Authority (OJK) is also offering incentives for banks, especially for housing mortgages.

items.title: Geely to integrate DeepSeek for AI-driven vehicle innovation
items.summary:
- Geely Auto Group will unveil an AI-driven strategy in early March 2025.
- The strategy includes integrating Geely's Xingrui AI model with DeepSeek's R1 technology.
- In 2025, Geely will expand its Galaxy product line with five new models, including two SUVs and three sedans featuring advanced technologies.

items.title: Taiwan’s legacy chipmakers struggle as China gains ground
Brookfield to Invest $20.7 Billion in French AI and Data Centers
items.summary:
- Brookfield Asset Management announced a €20 billion (US$20.7 billion) investment in France over the next five years.
- €15 billion (US$16.1 billion) will be directed towards data center projects via Data4.
- €5 billion (US$5.35 billion) will focus on AI-related infrastructure, including data transfer, chip storage, and energy generation.
- The investment aims to bolster Europe's competitiveness in the global AI sector against the US and China.

items.title: Indonesia’s Meeting.ai beats ChatGPT in country’s App Store
items.author: Hokiman Kurniawan
items.summary:
- As of February 10, 2025, Meeting.ai ranks third in the Productivity category on the Indonesian App Store, above ChatGPT.
- The cofounder, Hokiman Kurniawan, announced this achievement on February 9, 2025.
- Meeting.ai rose from sixth place within a day, showcasing increased user adoption in Indonesia.
- The app serves as an AI-powered meeting assistant that automatically takes notes.

items.title: Apple to unveil iPhone SE 4, Powerbeats Pro 2 earbuds
items.summary:
- Apple plans to unveil the fourth-generation iPhone SE and PowerBeats Pro 2 on **Feb. 11**.
- The release may be lower-profile due to the absence of official event invites.
- The iPhone SE 4 is expected to feature a design similar to the **iPhone 14**, replacing Touch ID with **Face ID** technology.
- It will likely include a **USB-C** port to comply with the Common Charger Directive.
- The PowerBeats Pro 2 will launch alongside the iPhone SE, marking the first update to Beats earbuds in **six years**.

items.title: Xpeng, Geely challenge Tesla with affordable EV options
items.summary:
- Geely Auto’s Galaxy and Xpeng’s Mona 03 are direct competitors to Tesla’s Model 3 in China.
- These EVs target middle-income buyers with prices around 150,000 yuan (US$20,580).
- The Mona 03 launched in August 2024, priced between 119,800 yuan (US$16,393) and 159,800 yuan (US$21,867).
- In January 2025, deliveries of the Mona 03 exceeded 15,000 units, with the overall EV market growing by 31% year-on-year to 900,000 units.
- The Mona 03 competes with Tesla’s Model 3, which starts at 227,500 yuan (US$31,131).
- Geely’s Galaxy EV targets young, middle-income drivers prioritizing affordability amidst economic concerns.

items.title: Chinese auto-parts maker rethinks expansion amid US tariffs
items.author: David Xiao Guowei
items.summary:
- APT Electronics from Guangzhou is reassessing its overseas expansion strategy due to potential US tariff changes.
- The company specializes in automotive lighting and exports to over 20 markets including the US.
- Chairman David Xiao noted that additional 10% tariffs won't have immediate effects but poses long-term challenges.
- APT is also monitoring proposed 25% tariffs on goods from Canada and Mexico.
- Since 2023, APT is considering production lines in North America, Southeast Asia, and Europe based on timing and costs.
- Xiao expresses cautious optimism about US-China relations, referencing APT's resilience during the 2019 trade war.
- APT, founded in 2006, serves clients like Signify, Samsung Electronics, and Geely Auto with intelligent lighting products.

items.title: Oyo reports $20m Q3 profit, 31% revenue growth
items.summary:
- Oyo reported a profit after tax (PAT) of 166 crore rupees (US$20 million) for Q3 FY25.
- This is an increase from 25 crore rupees (US$3 million) in the same quarter last year.
- Revenue grew by 31% year-on-year, reaching 1,695 crore rupees (US$204 million).
- Adjusted EBITDA for Q3 FY25 was 249 crore rupees (US$30 million), a 22% increase from the previous year.
- Recent developments include plans to invest $60 million in premium UK hotels and potential IPO filing by Q1 FY25.

items.title: Fintech firm Rapyd’s valuation drops to $3.5b
items.summary:
- Rapyd is seeking to raise US$300 million at a valuation of US$3.5 billion.
- This is down from a previous valuation of US$10 billion in 2021.
- Funds will partly be used to acquire a startup in the payments sector.
- In August 2023, Rapyd acquired PayU Global Payment Organisation for US$610 million.

items.title: Glasswall: The things anonymous founders say about VCs
items.summary:
- Tech in Asia launched Glasswall to assist founders in selecting investors.
- Glasswall allows anonymous reviews of venture capitalists (VCs) to promote transparency.
- Founders can provide feedback about VCs without revealing their identities, aiming to improve decision-making for startups.

items.title: French telecom firm to invest $3.1b in AI infrastructure
items.summary:
- French telecom company Iliad is investing €3 billion (US$3.1 billion) in AI infrastructure.
- The investment focuses on developing data centers and computing resources through its subsidiary OpCore.
- OpCore currently manages Iliad’s 13 data centers and plans to deploy several hundred megawatts of capacity initially, aiming for several gigawatts in the future.
- Iliad has partnered with France-based Mistral AI to utilize the “le Chat pro” AI model for its 15.5 million subscribers in France.

items.title: TikTok removed from smart TVs
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- TikTok has been removed from various smart TV platforms.
- The decision affects users who accessed TikTok via their TV devices.
- The removal comes amid rising scrutiny of the app's data privacy and security practices.

items.title: MediaTek expects up to $4.6b Q1 revenue from AI
items.summary:
- MediaTek forecasts a revenue increase of 2% to 10% for Q1 2025, projecting between NT$140.8 billion and NT$151.8 billion (approximately US$4.3 billion to US$4.6 billion).
- The rise in revenue is attributed to orders pulled forward due to tariff concerns and China's economic stimulus.
- The company remains optimistic about growth in AI-enabled devices despite global trade uncertainties.

items.title: China’s top 3 telecoms add DeepSeek to cloud services
items.summary:
- China Mobile, China Telecom, and China Unicom adopt AI models from DeepSeek into their services.
- This initiative supports advanced AI technology development, announced by China’s Ministry of Industry and Information Technology on Feb. 8.
- China Mobile has implemented DeepSeek-V1 and DeepSeek-R1 models, while China Telecom and China Unicom are using the DeepSeek-R1 model on their platforms.

items.title: Chips stacked against SEA? New rules may hinder AI boom in region
items.summary:
- Confusion over new US AI chip restrictions has impacted Southeast Asia's AI development.
- The US Executive Order 14141 limits the export of high-end AI chips crucial for cloud-based AI services.
- Singapore is under a US investigation regarding advanced Nvidia chip purchases by Chinese startup DeepSeek.
- Industry experts predict minimal short-term effects, but long-term growth could be hindered.
- Concerns exist over increasing US-China tensions affecting the region's AI ambitions.

items.title: Surviving the funding game: how timing can make or break your startup
items.author: Yeo Cheng Yong, Terence Lee, Eileen C. Ang
items.summary:
- Raising funds is crucial for startups to grow and succeed, but the process varies significantly between funding stages.
- The industry impacts the time needed between funding rounds; healthcare startups face longer development times than software or ecommerce startups.
- Economic conditions can lead to longer wait times for securing investments due to investor caution.
- Delayed funding can jeopardize a startup's runway, potentially leading to layoffs or bankruptcy, while quicker funding allows for growth and stability.

items.title: A brewing telco-fintech war in the PH
50 rising startups in Israel
items.summary:
- An updated list of Israeli startups recently raising funding.
- Includes companies up to the series E funding stage.
- Features key details about each funding round.
- Access to the full article requires a subscription.

items.title: Apple explores expressive robotics with Pixar-like lamp
items.summary:
- Apple shares details on consumer robotics research focusing on expressive movements for better human-robot interaction.
- A prototype lamp mimics Pixar’s Luxo Jr., demonstrating movements that convey attention and intention.
- The lamp responds to queries using Siri, indicating alignment with Apple’s smart home strategy, though still in research phase with no confirmed products.

items.title: India’s healthtech startup Mosaic Wellness revenue up 60%
FirstCry narrows Q3 loss by 69.5%, revenue up 14.3%
items.summary:
- FirstCry reported a consolidated net loss of 14.78 crore rupees (US$1.68 million) in Q3 FY25, a 69.5% improvement from 48.41 crore rupees (US$5.51 million) a year ago.
- The loss was 76.5% lower than the 62.85 crore rupees (US$7.16 million) loss in the previous quarter.
- Total revenue for the quarter reached 2,216.58 crore rupees (US$252.49 million).
- Adjusted EBITDA grew by 30% year-on-year to 293 crore rupees (US$33.38 million).
- Unique transacting customers increased by 17% to 9.8 million.
- FirstCry processed 11.1 million orders this quarter, with a gross merchandise value of 2,566.8 crore rupees (US$292.38 million).
- The company's shares fell by 9.87%, closing at 417.90 rupees (US$4.76) on Feb. 8, prior to the results announcement.

items.title: Taiwan officials to discuss US chip tariffs in Washington
items.author: Kuo Jyh-huei, Cynthia Kiang, Chen Pei-li
items.summary:
- Two senior officials from Taiwan's Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) will visit Washington to discuss potential tariffs on Taiwan-made semiconductor chips, which could reach up to 100%.
- Economics minister Kuo Jyh-huei announced that deputy minister Cynthia Kiang and Chen Pei-li will lead the talks.
- Discussions will focus on Taiwan's compliance with intellectual property agreements after Trump's remarks on tariffs between 25% and 100% to boost US chip production.
- Kuo emphasized Taiwan's strong partnership with US companies, highlighting TSMC's crucial role in the semiconductor industry.

items.title: Dairy startup Cremeitalia raises $2.1m series A
items.author: Prateek Mittal, Rajas Dhote
items.summary:
- Cremeitalia raised $2.1 million (18 crore rupee) in Series A funding led by Amit Jatia Family Office.
- Participants include BL Taparia Family Office, Nikhil Vora, and high-net-worth individuals.
- Founded in 2018, Cremeitalia uses traditional Italian methods to produce cheese.
- Funds will be used to expand operations, enhance R&D, and grow retail presence.
- The startup aims to boost direct-to-consumer sales and digital marketing efforts.
- Investment reflects growing interest in India's dairy sector, the largest milk producer in the world.

items.title: Enterprise browser startup hits $4.5b valuation in funding
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Island Technology Inc. achieves a $4.5 billion valuation after its latest funding led by Coatue Management.
- The company, based in Texas and Israel, specializes in secure internet browsers for businesses, launching its product in 2022.
- It has raised nearly $500 million from investors such as Sequoia Capital and Insight Partners, previously valued at $3 billion in early 2024.
- Leadership includes CEO Mike Fey (formerly of McAfee) and CTO Dan Amiga (previously at Symantec Corp).
- The company targets enterprises with a focus on security and productivity, serving clients in sectors like hotels, banks, and retailers.

items.title: Trump halts Biden’s $5b EV charging station program
items.summary:
- Trump administration has ordered states to stop spending from the $5 billion NEVI program for EV charging stations.
- The Federal Highway Administration announced the suspension on Feb. 6, with a review of program policies by new leadership.
- All NEVI guidance documents have been rescinded, and state EV deployment plans are on hold until further notice.
- Existing commitments will continue to receive reimbursements, but no new obligations are permitted.
- Nine states had 31 operational NEVI charging stations last year, with 126 public charging ports available.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores the investment landscape in Southeast Asia, focusing on new investors, notable funding rounds, and shifts in investment trends.
- It is divided into two sections: weekly updates on recent investors and macro trends in funding across the region.
- Credit for infographics goes to Yeo Cheng Yong, with editing by Terence Lee.

items.title: Taiwan expands semiconductor ties in Central Europe
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- Taiwan strengthens its semiconductor industry by forging partnerships in Central Europe.
- This initiative is aimed at enhancing technological cooperation and supply chain resilience.
- The collaboration focuses on developing advanced manufacturing and innovation in the semiconductor sector.

items.title: OpenAI to open first Germany office in Munich
items.summary:
- OpenAI plans to open its first office in Germany, starting operations in Munich soon.
- Germany is the largest market for OpenAI in Europe, with the highest number of users, paying subscribers, and developers.
- The decision follows discussions with German officials since 2023, supported by Germany Trade & Invest.
- This aligns with a trend of tech giants like Apple and Google expanding in Germany.
- The Munich office will complement existing locations in Paris, Brussels, and Dublin, underscoring the region’s importance in the AI sector.

items.title: Defense firm Anduril in talks for $2.5b, valued at $28b
items.author: Trae Stephens
items.summary:
- Anduril Industries is in talks to secure US$2.5 billion in funding.
- This funding could value the company at over US$28 billion.
- Led by venture capital firm Founders Fund, this follows a recent US$1.5 billion investment.
- The company is known for developing autonomous weapon systems and plans to invest nearly US$1 billion in a manufacturing facility in Ohio, covering an area similar to 87 football fields.
- No comments were provided by representatives of Anduril or Founders Fund regarding the funding discussions.

items.title: Indian edtech lender raises $2.9m bridge funding
items.author: Varun Chopra, Raheel Shah
items.summary:
- Eduvanz raised 25.52 crore rupee (US$2.9 million) in bridge funding.
- Funding co-led by Juvo Ventures and Capria Fund, with participation from Peak XV Partners and Unitus Ventures.
- Funds will be used for working capital, product development, and marketing.
- 26,405 compulsorily convertible preference shares issued at 9,667 rupee (US$110.12) each on Feb. 1.
- Founded in 2016, Eduvanz provides online education loans, raising nearly US$49 million to date.

items.title: Taiwan’s exports hit $38.71b as tech boom
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s exports grew by 4.4% year-on-year in January, reaching US$38.71 billion.
- This marks the 15th consecutive month of growth and surpasses forecasts of US$35.6 billion to US$36.7 billion.
- Imports fell by 17.2% year-on-year to US$28.74 billion, resulting in a trade surplus of US$9.97 billion, a 317.9% increase from last year.
- Strong demand for AI and high-performance computing has boosted the tech sector.
- China and Hong Kong remain the largest export markets but saw an 11.7% drop to US$10.71 billion.
- The MOF anticipates February exports to be between US$36.5 billion and US$37.7 billion, marking a potential increase of 16-20% year-on-year.

items.title: Coinbase must face New York lawsuit over securities sales
items.summary:
- A US federal judge ruled that Coinbase must face a lawsuit from customers claiming unlawful sales of securities.
- The decision was made by District Judge Paul Engelmayer on February 7.
- The judge rejected Coinbase’s argument of not being a "statutory seller" under federal law.
- The lawsuit includes claims under state laws in California, Florida, and New Jersey.
- The case was initially dismissed in February 2023 but was partially revived in April 2024 by the 2nd US Circuit Court of Appeals.
- Coinbase is also facing legal action from the US SEC regarding unregistered securities trading.

items.title: Meta to lay off 5% of workforce
items.summary:
- Meta Platforms will begin layoffs on Feb. 10, affecting approximately 5% of its workforce.
- Notifications will start at 5 am local time in various regions, including the US, followed by Europe, Asia, and Africa between Feb. 11 and Feb. 18.
- Employees in Germany, France, Italy, and the Netherlands are excluded from the layoffs due to local labor laws.
- The layoffs are referred to as “performance terminations,” focusing on the “lowest performers.”
- The company plans to speed up hiring for key roles like machine learning engineers from Feb. 11 to March 13 to support its 2025 strategy goals.

items.title: Elon Musk says he has no plans to buy TikTok
items.summary:
- Elon Musk clarifies he is not seeking to acquire TikTok and has not made any bid for it.
- He expressed that he does not use TikTok and is unfamiliar with the app's features.
- Musk stated acquiring companies is not typical for him, considering his purchase of Twitter (now X) an exception.
- His comments come amid ongoing scrutiny of TikTok by the US government due to national security concerns.
- US President Donald Trump has previously shown interest in TikTok, with potential decisions on its future expected in February.

items.title: Unsexy but still solves it
items.summary:
- The article emphasizes that most change occurs incrementally, making daunting goals manageable.
- It highlights the value of 'unsexy' solutions that effectively solve real problems, such as fileAI's work with unstructured data, which raised US$14 million.
- Several significant investment deals are reported, including:
  - Cashfree in India raised US$53 million.
  - Bigabid in Israel secured US$25 million.
  - Neusignal Therapeutics in Japan obtained US$14.4 million.
  - fileAI in Singapore raised US$14 million.
  - qeen.ai in Dubai received US$10 million in seed funding.
- Edge, an Indian company, was acquired by Phenom, an AI HR solutions firm, details undisclosed.
